body.p:
Louisville Ky 20 Sept 64
Gov Bramlette
Dear Sir

I have seen a letter from Maj Jas H Pinday of New York to you upon the subject of the Marine Brigade now on Garrison July at Vicksburg Miss, thirty four of whom represent themselves as Kentuckians, and have seen their petition on the subject of their greivances --
I think their case calls for relief and I hope you will respond to the letter of Maj Pinday, and give the weight of your name for their relief

Louisville Ky
20th Septr 1864
Guthrie James
To The Govr

says he has seen a letter from Maj Pinday to Govr, upon the subject of the Marine Brigade now Garrisoning Vicksburg; 34 of whom claim to be Kentuckians. Has seen their petition on subject of their Greivances; thinks their case calls for relief & urges the Govr to give the weight of his name for their relief.
L B No 6 -- 1864 P.476
Recd A. G. O. 21st Septr 1864
